title: Need an orange Wrenchmen or Riot to help me out!
body: So I did the latest graphics card driver update for my Geforce GT 640, ever since then I have been getting loads of FPS drops, and league loads slow and all that aswell. I have a stable internet connection and fast. I have never had this problem. Does anyone know how to fix it? I tried re-downloading the drivers from Nvidia website, but no avail. I need help please. Thanks!

replies.body: already gave you answer.
After I uninstall it though, which version should I go on for the GT 640? And do I do express or custom installation?

you uninstall it, select the default uninstall wizard, then restart your comp

also, make sure to uninstall the update, not the driver in general, the update should be separate from the general driver.

its exactly what I did when it happened to me about a week ago, comp usually can run at 125 fps, but was really low between 15-30, after uninstalling update through control panel it fixed it.

Also uninstalled the Nvidia GeForce experance app
Didn't work bro, I have tried 4 earlier drivers and uninstalled league, still not working

uninstall the driver, uninstall geforce experience (but you need to have it installed first for this to actually work) and then restart comp


or...
>Click Start
Click Control Panel
Click Performance and Maintenance and then System (in Category view) or System (in Classic view)
Select the Hardware Tab
Click Device Manager
Double-click on Display Adapters
Double-click on your NVIDIA GPU
Select the Driver Tab
Click on Roll Back Driver

Or... (my preferred way to get to device manager)

Windows key + x
Press M/Click Device Manager
Double-click on Display Adapters
Double-click on your NVIDIA GPU
Select the Driver Tab
Click on Roll Back Driver

if they dont appear you need to select view and click "show hidden devices"

note that this only works if the new driver is installed.

And if that doesn't work, maybe your issue is that you actually installed a driver thats way out of date, just select the update instead then

Hey, I am going to try this: Device manager > Display adapters > Geforce GT 640 then uninstall the drivers then after that I can just download the latest ones from there. Will my screen go black but i can still download the drivers if I do this method right?

first check that (if using a laptop, but that would be a 640m, but anyway) its not on power saver or anything, and makesure that the game just isn't capped at a low fps, you can't roll back if you uninstall them, other words, the way you are planning to do it is permanent, fail it and cant go back and retry.

+ updated yesterday to check, fps went low on comp, roll back worked
Sadly, It didn't work. Nothing is working. Still alot pf drops, even when it goes above 60 it feels laggy

Can't believe i hadn't asked yet...

Have you made sure the GPU fans are clean? if they are dirty they don't cool very well, and if they don't cool very well, the GPU will reduce its performance to prevent overheating, therefore lowering performance. I do recommend you don't try cleaning it yourself, you may check, but don't try clean it yourself, as you run a risk of damaging it, which will be worse than currently is. You can hire a professional to clean your comp and check everything is alright for between $30-$100 if need be.

But for all you know, the GPU might be fine, you might have a faulty connection or a corrupt processing file. You could have a badly fragmented HDD/SSD, one of your ddr could have come loose/disconnected/corrupted. A number of things could be wrong.

But ultimately i recommend rebuilding your comp with better parts anyway, parts are cheaper ad stronger now, it would be worth it, for example the 1070 and 1080, both stronger than a TitanX and cheaper(a dual 1070 is 140% the cost of 1 titan for about 230% the power).

If you need i could quickly put together a list of parts which would make a really strong computer for relatively cheap price ($800-$1500) or a strong as beast with high power, awesome cooling, LED lighting for a nice look, super quiet and massive processing for a few dollars over $3000, with plenty of gamer essential addons
Yeah I gave it a clean like a week ago now. So there is no issue with heat or dust and stuff.

>but don't try clean it yourself, as you run a risk of **damaging it**

cough
I know, I have tried every possible thing, I downloaded hextech repair tool and sent my logs to Riot. They will see what they can do.
you broke it ^
Yeah im going to get the best monitor on the market anyway 4k IPS display around about $800 considering the specs of it, yeah when you work, everything is easier :)

the 1 I have is very similar, it runs a dual 1070 instead.... because honesty.... a 1080 is only ~8% stronger for quite a hefty price increase.

So dual 1070 saves you a few hundred for pretty much the same thing.

My one is also more energy efficient and includes a monitor keyboard, attributes to keep the computer running key. Massively increased cooling and a super quiet run. + has nice red glow. Also, that one doesn't seem to sport an optical drive (mine runs bluray as well). In other words, same machine performance, with extra's for cheaper.

Dont worry man, I am saving up for this build! What do you think! going to play all games on this beast 
http://techbuyersguru.com/3500-ultimate-gaming-pc-build

Heyo! Can you try the solutions in the [**Low Frame Rate (FPS) Troubleshooting**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) article and let me know if that fixes the issue? 

Cheers!
Hey, I updated my graphics card driver for my Geforce GT 640, and ever since then, alot of FPS drops and league just runs slow. Where should I start in the article?

> [{quoted}](name=Xenomazul,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=TQzY7U4p,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-06-10T05:20:27.587+0000)
>
> Hey, I updated my graphics card driver for my Geforce GT 640, and ever since then, alot of FPS drops and league just runs slow. Where should I start in the article?

If updating your graphics card driver is causing the issues, try rolling back the update and lmk if that fixes your issue.

Too late to re-roll back, I used the DDU program and went to the 2nd latest driver even with fresh installments and still getting worse. I can't even do a system restore as it says no files have been changed and wont do the restore. I have physically tried everything and dont know what to do
I'm going to take a step back and start from square one. Have you already checked your system for viruses/malware?
Yes, use avast. No threats found. Got CCleaner aswell, no issues in the registry

Hey man I did the microsoft services right, I checked the hide all microsoft services, and then clicked disable all as it says in the guide, and now I cant right click on my desktop to go to nvidia control pannel? How do I get there?
try going back to an earlier driver.
Do i have to uninstall just the graphic driver? Or do I just go ahead and get a earlier version?

you can find the graphic driver update in your programs and features (on windows) just uninstall it through there, should work.

- Had same issue when updated GT 630

#######gonnagetmesomedual1070fuckcrappy630
See if your drivers are running at 100% sometime with updates they revert back to minimal performance
Where do I check that for Nvidia? In the control pannel? Because I don't know once you install a new driver, it resets the settings? Where should I check first?

> [{quoted}](name=Xenomazul,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=TQzY7U4p,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-06-10T04:50:13.112+0000)
>
> Where do I check that for Nvidia? In the control pannel? Because I don't know once you install a new driver, it resets the settings? Where should I check first?

It should be in the control panel Manage settings then power control and set to prefer maximum
I can't get to my Nvidia control panel since I disabled all microsoft services. I tried disabling that and just repiared the client. If it doesn't work, I will get back to you! :)
